meanings.definition: A chemotherapy drug used to treat various types of cancer.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed taxol to help fight the cancer cells.
meanings.sent2: Many patients receive taxol as part of their cancer treatment.
meanings.sent3: The taxol went to a fancy party with the cancer cells, but they weren't invited!
meanings.sent4: The taxol acted like a brave soldier, attacking the enemy cancer cells.
meanings.sent5: The taxol worked like a superhero, saving the body from the evil cancer villains.

meanings.definition: The brand name for paclitaxel, a medication used to treat breast, ovarian, lung, bladder, prostate, melanoma, esophageal, as well as other types of solid tumor cancers.
meanings.sent1: She was relieved when the doctor mentioned taxol as part of her cancer treatment plan.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacy stocked up on taxol to meet the high demand from cancer patients.
meanings.sent3: The taxol and the cancer cells had a dance-off, but the taxol's moves were too strong!
meanings.sent4: The taxol was like a shield protecting the body from the invading cancer cells.
meanings.sent5: The taxol was a powerful weapon in the battle against the relentless cancer invasion.
